title: Ho una cartella in local folder che non riesco a eliminare
content: La cartella che indico nell'allegato ha una icona diversa da tutte le altre cartelle, non ricordo quando l'ho creata, ora e vuota, mi crea confusione vederla e vorrei cancellarla ma come si vede nell'allegato cliccando con il pulsante destro non c'è una opzione elimina. Qualcuno mi sa dire come eliminarla/cancellarla? Grazie

title: copy account from one computer to another
content:
I have a MacBook Air and an iMac desk top computer. There are 6 email accounts on the MacBook Air and 4 on the iMac. I am using Thunderbird MacBook Air 115.12.2 (64 bit) and on the iMac 140.6.esr (64 bit). For some reason I am unable to set up the 5th account on the iMac (Wrong password etc)

Can I just export the 5th account on MacBook Air and import that account on the iMac? The export file (I guess all accounts) is 8.17 GB .

If I import that file to the iMac will I duplicate the emails already associated with the existing 4 accounts or will I be able to select which account I want to import along with the associated settings and passwords?

Thank you, Ton Aston
creator: Tony_Aston

title: Can't log into imap account that used to work no problem
content:
For the last two day when I start Thunderbird I get the message "The current operation on 'Inbox' did not succeed. The email server for account [edited]@herrinonline.net responded: expecting ")" instead of "(".

This is happening with all 4 email addresses I have. 3 on ionos and 1 on gmail.

I have checked all the settings for the Ionos webmail server and the Gmail server and they are correct. I have deleted of of the accounts and recreated it but still get the same message.

Attached is a capture of the actual error message. If I try to synch with any of the email addresses I get the same message for that email

Can you offer any help?

Thanks,

John
creator: john9910

title: Add-on Allow HTML Temp not compatible with TBird 146.0.1
content:
Since the upgrade to Thunderbird 146, the plugin for Allow HTML Temp has been disabled. Following Find an alternative add-on button, I get directed to an upgraded version of the add-on 10.1.1, see screen clip, which states it should be OK up to version 147.

I had the same problem last time the upgrade was to Tbird 144 and Allow HTML Temp add-on was updated to 10.0.8. I followed up with the add-on developer who claimed it was Thunderbird is erroneously rejecting the add-on. They said "Thunderbird itself checks the compatiblity on add-on installation at AMO, where the add-on version 10.0.8 is marked as compatible up to 144 at the moment." I don't understand what the "AMO" term means. The developer sent me a modified version of their update, but closed the issue with "Not an Add-on Issue. Compatibility check on AMO failed."

It looks like the same problem is happening again. Can you please tell me if this is a problem with Thunderbird checking, or is it with the add-on? When will this type of issue be solved?

(I was also told by the developer that I might have changed some feature of Thunderbird from standard, but that is not true)
creator: itdcmy

title: images on inbox mail In Thunderbird
content:

Dear Sirs' Happy New Year I have a problem that I have had no luck in resolving via the Thunderbird Help option. My problem is that recently I have been unable to receive any images on all my mail which I receive within my Inbox. I have chcked the mail within Thunderbirds Server (ie BT), and all the images do appear on all the mail at this source. I would be most grateful if you could please help me in this matter. title: Export Thunderbird profile from windows to Linux version
content: I just installed Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS to an old computer and I want to export my profiles and contacts from my other Windows computer Thunderbird, over to the new Linux version of Thunderbird. I suppose the other option is to re-import from Gmail contacts. Please advise. As others migrate from Windows to Linux this could be a common question.

title: Language keeps changing back to Canadian English
content:
Hello Frustrating.. I live in UK and want Thunderbird to work in English English but it keeps changing back to Canadian. I have been in settings and added English English and made it the default but TB keeps changing the setting and making Canadian the active language. How do I stop it?

TB 140.6.0esr (64-bit)
